ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: increased skills in drawing, creative thinking, use of programs like Rhino.
Physical and virtual model making, Rhino, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Indesign, creative thinking, descriptive analysis, presentation skills, visual observation, drawing/sketching
Learned about the fundamentals of architectural thinking and the human condition.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The workload was a bit too high considering the circumstances; I felt like some assignments were closer to busy work rather than work that helped me to learn something. (e.g. the pepper project was unnecessarily long, I felt that we would've gotten the same amount out of it had it gone on for a month or so rather than 110 days). I also repeatedly found myself sacrificing sleep and my mental health to try and prepare work for the class.
strengths: Trattie and the teaching assistants (Cal and Rachel) were very good. They gave us lots of feedback and the classes were engaging.
It was a lovely engaging class with a wonderful professor and amazing TAs.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Section and feedback sessions were helpful, and I enjoyed the guest lectures; they were a fun reprieve from the fast pace of the course. I think that more opportunities for individual, rather than group critic sessions would have been helpful.

This was very conducive to online learning because the live classes kept everyone accountable no matter what time zone we were on and we all looked forward to going to class. Trattie also adjusted the course to make it a new and exciting class that took advantage of the unique circumstances instead of making it a worse version of the class it was in previous years.
Was very flexible and accommodating to each individual classmate.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would recommend the class only if a student was very interested in pursuing architecture as a career/major.
definitely! lots of work but also very rewarding. you learn a lot and the class is fun and engaging. Trattie and the TA's are amazing.
Yes because if you are interested in architecture and art, this is a good class to dive into its world/
